article_title: Sink Hole On Missouri Golf Course
article_text:
Taney County, MO

A new hole was added to the Top of the Rock golf course in Taney County, Missouri - but this one was not planned.

Part of the hill gave way to a massive sinkhole.

The course just hosted a national event which included Jack Nicklaus and other internationally famous golfers.

But Friday, it was a sinkhole that attracted the attention.

At around 6:30 am Friday morning crews noticed two sink holes near the driving range, just in front of the pro-shop. By mid-morning, it all became one large hole.

When last checked, it measured eighty feet long by sixty feet wide and thirty-five feet deep.

Local experts believe this is a soil collapse. Soil will often fill the cavities in the bedrock just below the ground's surface.
